Class Polynome

java.lang.Object
Polynome
public class Polynome extends Object
The Polynomial class allows you to simulate the behavior of a polynomial of the form a0 + a1 x + a2 x2 + ... + an xn, whose coefficients are stored in an array.

For example, for the table of coefficients [2.0, 3.0, 5.0], the polynomial corresponding is: 2 + 3x + 5x².

This class offers the following operations:

  • Construction of a polynomial from a table of coefficients.
  • Access and modification of coefficients via a getter and a setter.
  • Calculation of the sum of two polynomials (add method).
  • Comparing polynomials (isIdentical method).
  • Evaluation of the polynomial for a given value of x (evaluate method).
  • Recovery of the degree of the polynomial (getDegree method).

  • Field Details

    • coefficients

      private double[] coefficients
      Table containing the coefficients of the polynomial. The index i corresponds to the coefficient of the term x^i.

  • Constructor Details

    • Polynome

      public Polynome(double[] coeffs)
      Constructor that initializes the polynomial with the provided coefficient table. The coefficients are assumed to be ordered in increasing order with respect to the power of x. For example, coefficients[0] is the coefficient of the constant term (x^0), coefficients[1] that of the term x^1, etc.
      Parameters:
      coeffs - Table of polynomial coefficients (not modified by the class).

  • Method Details

    • getCoefficient

      public double getCoefficient(int index)
      Getter which returns the coefficient located at the specified index. The index corresponds to the power of x.
      Parameters:
      index - The array index, corresponding to the power of x.
      Returns:
      The coefficient associated with x^index.

    • setCoefficient

      public void setCoefficient(int index, double coefficient)
      Setter that changes the coefficient to the specified index. The index corresponds to the power of x.
      Parameters:
      index - The index in the array, corresponding to the power of x.
      coefficient - The new coefficient value for x^index.

    • add

      public Polynome add(Polynome other)
      Method which calculates the sum of this polynomial with another polynomial. The sum is defined by adding the coefficients of the same degree (same power of x).
      Parameters:
      other - The polynomial to add to this polynomial.
      Returns:
      A new polynomial that represents the sum of the two polynomials.

    • isIdentical

      public boolean isIdentical(Polynome other)
      Method that checks if two polynomials are identical. Two polynomials are considered identical if they have the same number of coefficients and that their respective coefficients are equal.
      Parameters:
      other - The polynomial to compare.
      Returns:
      true if the polynomials have the same array length and the same coefficients, false otherwise.

    • evaluate

      public double evaluate(double x)
      Method that calculates the value of the polynomial for a given real value of x. For example, if the polynomial is 2 + 3x + 5x² and x = 10, the method will return 2 + 3*10 + 5*100 = 532.
      Parameters:
      x - The value for which we want to evaluate the polynomial.
      Returns:
      The value of the polynomial at x.

    • getDegree

      public int getDegree()
      Returns the degree of the polynomial, i.e. the greatest power of x having a non-zero coefficient. If all coefficients are zero, the method will return -1 to indicate that the polynomial is the zero polynomial.
      Returns:
      The degree of the polynomial, or -1 if all coefficients are zero.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Method for displaying polynomials
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the Polynomial String

    • multiply

      public Polynome multiply(Polynome other)
      Method which calculates the product of this polynomial with another polynomial. The product is defined by multiplying the coefficients together.
      Parameters:
      other - The polynomial to add to this polynomial.
      Returns:
      A new polynomial that represents the sum of the two polynomials.
